posts.post_content: Anyone have a low grade Cap Anson card they’re open to selling? I’m not sure I can afford it, but would love to see what’s available. I’d be most interested in an N300 Mayo or N162. An N172 OJ is definitely out of the budget at the moment. I also have some T206 offbacks if open to partial trades.

Good morning.
I have one that I posted about previously; here's the thread: [url]https://www.net54baseball.com/showthread.php?t=343935[/url] 
I am still planning on consigning it somewhere so as to get what I assume is the best price, but if you'd like to purchase without fees then I'd be game.  Let me know if you are interested,
Richard
Richard - do you have a price for the card?  I'm not interested, just asking for Tyler.

[quote name="Fred" post=2402002]Richard - do you have a price for the card?  I'm not interested, just asking for Tyler.[/QUOTE]

It's hard to know.  Firstly, post-pandemic prices have become so inflated.  Secondly, it's a relatively rare card to come up at auction at all.  Thirdly, I honestly have not seen one in such raggedy condition, at least for years (if ever).

Honestly, I'd be thrilled to get 5K for it.
Really cool card. I think it’s a little lower grade than I’d prefer. Looking at recent prices, I’m thinking an authentic or low grade N300 Mayo is probably my best bet.
